PKP Open Typesetting Stack Plugin (Beta)

Thank you for your interest in OTS! This service, and associated OJS plugin, are both in beta, and expectations of reliability, availability and accuracy should be calibrated with that in mind. An Open Typesetting Stack email address and API token are required to use the conversion service. You can register for our demo OTS instance here. For future news on non-demo, non-beta plans and services for this stack, please follow the PKP blog, or keep an eye on the PKP support forum.

Bugs: We welcome bug reports and feature requests in the following locations (please search for similar bugs/requests before submitting, to reduce duplicates):

  • OJS plugin issues
  • OTS service issues

Caveats: The Open Typesetting Stack (OTS) service and associated PKP plugins are still under active development and have been released in beta mode to enable testing and feedback from interested users. It is made available on an 'as is, where is' basis without guarantees on its suitability for any particular use. With input from users of this beta mode, this open source software system will be subject to further changes, with PKP reserving the right to determine the form that its OTS service will take in the future. If you are interested in having unlimited access to OTS, or are interested in receiving paid support for OTS, please contact us at pkp.contact@gmail.com.

Specify whether you want to use site-wide or user-specific authentication to OTS. Journal-wide authentication is simpler, allowing you to share a single administrator-level OTS email address across your entire journal. However, if you anticipate individual authors wanting to access OTS directly (rather than through OJS) and want to avoid any potential issues around blind review, you can select user-specific authentication, which requires them to each specify their own OTS email address in their OJS user preferences. Most people will want to use journal-wide authentication.

On this page, you can automatically batch-convert already-published articles from PDF or Word formats to JATS XML using PKP's Open Typesetting Stack, without needing to navigate to each article individually. While this will generally not produce perfect results -- the Open Typesetting Stack is normally intended to be used together with the included Texture editor to improve the quality of XML -- it should be sufficient to populate your journals' OAI feed with structured data for harvesting purposes. The Open Typesetting Stack will return converted XML to your journals under the "Production Ready Files" stage for each article that is converted here. You can still navigate to each article individually to improve formatting with Texture after performing this batch conversion.
